questions.question: Into how many specific territories (Nadus) was the ancient Kumari Kandam divided, and can you name the seven major divisions?
questions.answer: It was divided into 49 territories. The seven major divisions were Ezhu Thenga Nadu, Ezhu Madurai Nadu, Ezhu Munpalai Nadu, Ezhu Pinpalai Nadu, Ezhu Kunra Nadu, Ezhu Gunakarai Nadu, and Ezhu Kurumpanai Nadu.

questions.question: What specific river, according to the text, originated from the Meru Mountain in Kumari Kandam and flowed eastward into the ocean?
questions.answer: The Pahruli River.

questions.question: Which Chola King is credited with establishing the "Solar Dynasty" (So-La) after migrating from the submerged Kumari Kandam to the "Mina Desam" (Egypt/Middle East)?
questions.answer: Oli Sembiyan (also known as Jayamanjunan).

questions.question: According to the text, the Vindhya Mountains were originally known by which name connected to a Chola King?
questions.answer: Nerivetta (associated with King Nerivettan).

questions.question: Which ancient continent (Dwipa) corresponds to the region of modern-day Greece and Turkey, and why was it named so?
questions.answer: Krauncha Dwipa (Bird Island/Heron Island), named because of the abundance of birds like herons and cranes.

questions.question: Who ruled the "Monkey Land" and "Tiger Land" in the Salmala Dwipa before the Great Deluge forced them to migrate to India?
questions.answer: The Vanaras (Monkey clan) and the ancestors of the Cholas (Tiger flag).

questions.question: What geological explanation does the text give for the "Seven Seas" mentioned in Puranas (Milk Ocean, Curd Ocean, etc.)?
questions.answer: They were named after the color or nature of the water (White river/Pale river), not literally containing milk or curd.

questions.question: Which Pandyan King excavated the Pahruli River to irrigate the Peruvala Nadu?
questions.answer: Pandyan Nediyon.

questions.question: According to the texts chronology, when did the "First Great Deluge" occur that submerged the Peruvian/Kumari lands?
questions.answer: Approximately 13,900 B.C.

questions.question: Which mountain range does the text identify as the "Meru Mountain," explicitly stating it is not the Himalayas?
questions.answer: A mountain range that existed in the center of the Indian Ocean (Kumari Kandam) with 49 peaks.

questions.question: Who were the specific patron deities and sages of the First Sangam (Thalai Sangam)?
questions.answer: Lord Shiva (Irayanar), Murugan, and Agastya.

questions.question: What was the capital city of the Middle Sangam (Idai Sangam)?
questions.answer: Kapadapuram.

questions.question: Which Pandyan King presided over the Last Sangam (Kadai Sangam)?
questions.answer: Mudathirumaran III.

questions.question: How many years did the Middle Sangam last, and how many poets were part of it?
questions.answer: It lasted 3,700 years with 3,700 poets (including Agastya and Tolkappiyar).

questions.question: Which rare grammar text served as the standard during the First Sangam?
questions.answer: Agastyam.

questions.question: Which Pandyan King was cursed by Agastya to become an elephant (Indradyumna) and was later redeemed by Vishnu?
questions.answer: Manojava Pandyan (also called Parameswara Pandyan).

questions.question: What literary work mentions that 89 Pandyan Kings patronized the First Sangam?
questions.answer: The commentary by Nakkirar on Irayanar Akapporul.

questions.question: Which Pandyan King ruled when the Second Sangam's capital, Kapadapuram, was submerged?
questions.answer: Mudathirumaran (who then moved to North Madurai).

questions.question: Who were the "Seven Patrons" (Kadai Ezhu Vallalgal) of the Last Sangam era?
questions.answer: Pari, Ori, Kari, Adhiyaman, Began, Ay, and Nalli.

questions.question: Which text was authorized by the Middle Sangam and remains the oldest extant Tamil grammar?
questions.answer: Tolkappiyam.

questions.question: Based on astronomical calculations cited in the text, what is the exact birth date of Lord Rama?
questions.answer: 21st April, 7013 B.C.

questions.question: Which Chola King was the contemporary of Lord Rama and participated in the events of that era?
questions.answer: Kambu Kandan.

questions.question: Who was the Pandyan King reigning during the time of the Ramayana?
questions.answer: Anantha Guna Pandyan.

questions.question: What relation was the demon king Ravana to the god of wealth, Kubera?
questions.answer: They were half-brothers (sons of Sage Visravas).

questions.question: Which Chera King is said to have defeated Ravana when he tried to enter the Tamil country?
questions.answer: Mandaran Cheral (or simply the Chera King at the time).

questions.question: According to the text, which Sage gave the "Aditya Hridayam" mantra to Rama, and where did this happen?
questions.answer: Agastya, during Rama's stay in the Tamil lands/Dandakaranya.

questions.question: Who was the father of King Dasharatha?
questions.answer: King Aja.

questions.question: Which Chola King married the daughter of King Vikukshi of the Solar Dynasty?
questions.answer: Ulagalitha Cholan.

questions.question: According to the text, when did the Rama-Ravana war take place?
Who founded the city of Mathura after killing the Asura Lavana?
questions.answer: Shatrughna (Ramas brother).

questions.question: What was the name of the Chola King who gave his own flesh to save a dove, linking the Chola lineage to the "Sibi" legend?
questions.answer: Sibi Chakravarthy (Sembiyan).

questions.question: Which ancient sage is claimed to be the ancestor of the Cholas, Pandyas, and Cheras via his marriage to a Vidarbha princess?
questions.answer: Agastya.

questions.question: Who was the wife of the sage Rishyasringa, who performed the Putra Kameshti Yaga for Dasharatha?
questions.answer: Shanta (Dasharatha's daughter).

questions.question: Which Solar Dynasty king was cursed to become a "Chandala" (outcast) and had a new heaven created for him by Viswamitra?
questions.answer: Trisanku (Satyavrata).

questions.question: Who was the mother of Ravana?
questions.answer: Kaikasi (daughter of the Asura Sumali).

questions.question: What is the exact calculated birth date of Lord Krishna in the text?
questions.answer: 27th July, 3112 B.C.

questions.question: When did Kali Yuga officially begin according to the text?
questions.answer: 18th February, 3102 B.C.

questions.question: Which Chera King is famous for feeding both the Pandava and Kaurava armies during the 18-day war?
questions.answer: Perunchotru Uthiyan Cheralathan.

questions.question: Who was the Pandyan King during the Mahabharata War who fought on the side of the Pandavas?
questions.answer: Raja Kunjaran (Mudathirumaran III).

questions.question: Which Chola King participated in the Mahabharata War?
questions.answer: Kumarankusan (or Sumana Cholan).

questions.question: Who wrote the Tamil version of the Mahabharata during the Sangam age?
questions.answer: Perundevanar (Bharatham Padiya Perundevanar).

questions.question: What happened to the city of Dwaraka 36 years after the Mahabharata War?
questions.answer: It was submerged by the sea due to a natural calamity/tsunami.

questions.question: Who was the only son of Dhritarashtra to survive the war (fighting for the Pandavas)?
questions.answer: Yuyutsu.

questions.question: Who was the Naga princess who married Arjuna and bore the son Iravan?
questions.answer: Ulupi.

questions.question: What is the text's claim regarding the complexion of Veda Vyasa and Krishna?
questions.answer: They were black (Dravidian complexion), challenging the "white Aryan" theory.

questions.question: Who succeeded the Pandavas to the throne of Hastinapura?
questions.answer: Parikshit (grandson of Arjuna).

questions.question: Which Rishi cursed King Parikshit to die by snakebite?
questions.answer: Srinki (son of Sage Samika).

questions.question: Who performed the "Sarpa Yaga" (Snake Sacrifice) to avenge Parikshit's death?
questions.answer: Janamejaya.

questions.question: According to the text, where did Ashwatthama migrate after the war?
questions.answer: To the Arabian/Iraq region (specifically Kufa), linking him to later Semitic lineages.

questions.question: Which Chola King is said to have married Subhadra (Krishnas sister) in a previous birth legend mentioned in the text?
questions.answer: Manojava Pandyan (Note: Text attributes this to a Pandyan in the context of Thiruthangal).

questions.question: Who was Pandyan Pulathiyan and what is his shocking connection to the Bible?
questions.answer: He was a Pandyan governor in Judaea, identified as Pontius Pilate, who presided over the trial of Jesus.

questions.question: According to the text, where did Jesus Christ (Iso) spend his "lost years" studying?
questions.answer: At Nalanda University (Buddhism) and in Mylapore/Chennai (Jainism/Saivism).

questions.question: Who was the Tamil Siddha said to be a descendant of Ashwatthama living in Iraq?
questions.answer: Siddhan Bhoga Dathan.

questions.question: How is Siddhan Bhoga Dathan connected to the history of Islam in the text?
questions.answer: He protected the family of Hussein (grandson of Prophet Muhammad) during the conflict at Karbala.

questions.question: Which Hindu saint is claimed to have died fighting alongside Hussein?
questions.answer: A saint named "Val".

questions.question: What date does the text provide for the birth of Prophet Muhammad?
questions.answer: 29th August, 571 A.D.

questions.question: Who was the 24th Tirthankara of Jainism and which Magadha King was his contemporary?
questions.answer: Mahavira (598527 B.C.); King Kunikan (Ajatasatru).

questions.question: Which Pandyan King was converted from Jainism to Saivism by Sambandar?
questions.answer: Koon Pandyan (Ninra Seer Nedumaran).
